pullRequest.body:
A point in a subset of a field is either a point of unique differentials, or isolated. In both cases, there is a definite value for the derivative of a map (its unique derivative in the former case, zero in the latter case). This means there is no choice involved, contrary to what happens in higher dimension. This remark means we can remove many `UniqueDiffWithinAt` assumptions in one-dimensional settings.

This PR proves the new lemma that a point is either isolated or a point of unique differentiability. The application to cleanup the library will be in a further PR (#20816)

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Thanks for the reviews! Hopefully everything is taken into account now.
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
bors r+

Thanks!

maintainer merge

Thank you for splitting!

Could we get some inline comments? The proofs are quite long.

Thanks!

maintainer merge
bors r+

nit:
```suggestion
  let d n := v n - x
```
Why not make `hc n` the first line of your `calc` block?

```suggestion
    suffices Tendsto (fun n ↦ ‖c n‖⁻¹ ⁻¹) atTop atTop by simpa
```

```suggestion
      _ = ((u n) ⁻¹ * u n) * ‖r‖ * u n := by ring
```

Aternatively,
```suggestion
      _ = ‖r‖ * u n := by field_simp [(u_pos n).ne']; ring
```
A recent request as to not squeeze terminal simps (unless they're performance-sensitive). Can you adapt this, please?
Combine this with the previous line?
I think it's more readable this way: it singles out the only interesting argument, and otherwise it makes for a very heavy line.
Can these two lines become one?
I don't think so.
Would you like to inline at least the third term? (The other two are up to you.)

pullRequest.title: feat: in one dimension, a point is either isolated or a point of unique differentiability
